claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling in tumors.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
Type I interferon response score (normalized units): 3.1 vs 1.0

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase following mRNA vaccination.

evidence.quote: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.
Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome: 62.3% vs 37.3%

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I after mRNA vaccination, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

evidence.quote: A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome: 40.6% vs 20.6%

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases after mRNA vaccination, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.
PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue: 2.4x vs 1.0x

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Combined mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 intervention improves tumor control in mice.

evidence.quote: Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice
Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change: 1.8x vs 1.0x

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with better outcomes in metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment.

evidence.quote: aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort
Retrospective human survival comparison p-value: p=0.01

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is necessary for the observed sensitization benefit.

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: The mRNA component is essential for the sensitization effect, not just the lipid particle delivery vehicle.

evidence.quote: Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.
